Description: Indian Spurge Tree is a succulent plant with twisting columnar branches. It is often mistaken for a cactus. Leaves come out in the late summer/ fall. Flowers are small, yellow, like small buttons, alternating with the thorns, all along the stem, arranged spirally. This plant is native to India.
Where: Opposite NPS, 12A Main Road, HAL II Stage, Indiranagar, Bangalore
Language Common: Hedge Euphorbia, Indian Spurge Tree, Oleander Spurge
Name: Indian Spurge Tree
